.. _`bio/mixcr/assemblepartial`:

MIXCR ASSEMBLE PARTIAL
======================

Overlaps alignments coming from the same molecule which partially cover CDR3 regions

**URL**: https://docs.milaboratories.com/mixcr/reference/mixcr-assemblePartial/

Example
-------

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule test_mixcr_assemble:
        input:
            "alignment.vdjca"
        output:
            vdjca="collected.vdjca",
            report="report.txt"
        params:
            extra=""
        wrapper:
            "0.50.4-2418-g8fefa1e53/bio/mixcr/assemblepartial"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.

When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies
---------------------

* ``mixcr==4.0.0``

Input/Output
------------
**Input:**

* Aligned sequences from `mixcr/align`

**Output:**

* ``report``: txt alignment report
* ``json``: json alignment report
* ``vdjca``: collected alignment



Params
------

* ``extra``: Optional parameters





Authors
-------

* Thibault Dayris


Code
----

.. code-block:: python

    #!/usr/bin/python3
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

    """This is the Snakemake Wrapper for mixcr align"""

    __author__ = "Thibault Dayris"
    __copyright__ = "Copyright 2020, Thibault Dayris"
    __email__ = "thibault.dayris@gustaveroussy.fr"
    __license__ = "MIT"

    from snakemake.shell import shell

    log = snakemake.log_fmt_shell(stdout=True, stderr=True)

    extra = snakemake.params.get("extra", "")
    species = snakemake.params.get("species", "hsa")


    if "report" in snakemake.output.keys():
        extra += " --report {} ".format(snakemake.output["report"])

    if "json" in snakemake.output.keys():
        extra += "----json-report {}".format(snakemake.output["json"])

    shell(
        "mixcr assemblePartial --force-overwrite {extra} --threads {snakemake.threads} "
        "{snakemake.input} {snakemake.output.vdjca} {log}"
    )
